thread.title: Central Park is finally enjoying snow after 701 days | Video | kwwl.com
thread.title_full: Central Park is finally enjoying snow after 701 days | Video | kwwl.com

title: Central Park is finally enjoying snow after 701 days | Video | kwwl.com
text: Central Park is finally enjoying snow after 701 days Weather Alert ...Dangerous Wind Chills Continue into Early Today.... ...Bitter Cold Wind Chills for Tonight into Early Wednesday... Arctic cold continues across the area with temperatures below zero and accompanying wind chills often near or in the 20s or 30s below zero this morning. This extreme Arctic air combined with breezy winds at times will continue to create dangerously cold conditions into Tuesday, with wind chill values as low as 35 below zero this morning. A moderation is anticipated by afternoon. Although slightly warmer, very cold wind chills will continue tonight into Wednesday morning prior to a brief break in the bitter cold by Wednesday afternoon and Thursday. Please continue to check the latest road conditions prior to any travel in and around Iowa as crews continue to work to improve road conditions. ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CST TODAY... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 9 AM CST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 35 below zero this morning. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 25 below zero; especially tonight into early Wednesday. * WHERE...All of central Iowa. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Warning, until noon CST Tuesday. For the Wind Chill Advisory, from noon Tuesday to 9 AM CST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes early today. * ADDITIONAL INFORMATION...After a break in the bitter cold, another Arctic intrusion arrives for Thursday night and Friday night. This will push wind chill values back down to 20 to 30 below zero with bitter cold lows and very cold highs expected. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. && ...Dangerous Wind Chills Continue into Early Today.... ...Bitter Cold Wind Chills for Tonight into Early Wednesday...
